document.title: Oregon English Language Arts & Literacy Standards: Kindergarten

55E8C3CE0F6D49ECB62A3C4813026E59.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

0B00CC07A9244392A0842143F7A62AB1.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

4201CCCF5CC74A40A86B302A712BDD95.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

80467B110F214137BE70227DBA3FC4F7.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

09F0CCB26DF2483BBA823C4DC3822C47.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

44FCE36506A4418C98DCB4C111118C68.description: With guidance and support, follow agreed-upon rules for discussions.

82B8A891A2EC4C85BBCF868E1D51EAF9.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

4B626F882C9D4D26B5573FE436F441B8.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

AABCE7183D354262977A87520EB1E513.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

9CDE8EA7D23B4A7C9DC08D82B4B03F29.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

2BE648AD12914962933F808A2C4ABE24.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

69718C10107946D39D9B13E1ADA5502F.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

D56548EBE39C46BD83AE76E6BB330ED6.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

82845CE14B5C428A9B4AE07D3557CC4D.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

10F69B8CCC20426287537575EFBC83FB.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

EDB14782732B4068A32CD685896FA6AD.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action.

29B59239D7614BBDBAA9756CF0FEA57A.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use.

4E89FC4EE22C4256A2137865346A6607.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their antonyms.

FE912F93D99D4AA2A67D07AA2EC34FEE.description: Sort common objects into categories to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

EB0E6C8262904CB4999A262F216A2980.description: With guidance and support, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

5810DF6FE4994ADBAF51CBBE52F7F4AB.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

A378251FAB894EF7A182AEEE9BA065ED.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately.

58364B7DCBAB419EB4F9308B39107B7E.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

9DA7B4774E4C48BDA2106F9A1831FD04.description: Write a letter or letters for all consonant and short-vowel phonemes.

AAD4A76CB7DD4EFD9C250467E615FF5B.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

65A55B908A6E4AB4A833E07762A9FFFE.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

2FC7479872094BBB8C9376D48EF38478.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

C9875F84905E4E7EB24F242E5F62F1E4.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions.

7AD6BBB5659149C2B2F35CFCF504E963.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/.

4BED3A59A70B48F696E46C54343DE6CD.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

5B6C246D3DEE4C3FAF11F2491A93F804.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

A422F5CF6BB845FC8694F123A6C50097.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

90FFD792245F49F2B18857E4464F38A8.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

979483C398F745D394A1FFFB76576AFA.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

84A27A2FE0534403B59EF582FE9B2084.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

93D1FCCE7BDF41BEB42E37648E420D56.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

B887A87CA3784024B16E22E76C2AC11C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

81FFCDD38ED4496EB65CE0B040BB70C0.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

1E43A439367548EE97CBD6797F93233A.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

85B81F76B27E4F9D92B1C0722228F286.description: With guidance and support, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

F536F85039FE4AD5A0F1F9FE8F5A3032.description: With guidance and support, participate in shared research and writing projects.

9B8D66E5BC5345DF89374E0595AC6C23.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

2B96C607AE494C26A8E6E291618E78E2.description: With guidance and support, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

B9C5D08D38EC469F88DB817D23AFBB4F.description: With guidance and support, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

1DE5E50E761F4A69B5C62A3F1807587E.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, sequence the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

E527742B31824C04B8075A521F430D77.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

E227F70E3BF44BA49803B39520D1D9B9.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces, in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book.

7FB1EA625772446188E8C9B097C15920.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

42C8060F5B32484BB83B6AB641B26A4E.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

C3793147BA2747F2B85A6B06211252E5.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

ACAA9AE1456D42769A73322CE9CDF5BB.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

AB8F807FF69D47A498B946D366FB8F00.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

5E55D67AEC154C1A8D7827C52FA69839.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

EDA9BEDD26B24B9696C600DF9D6186B1.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

716FA041934A41F085274EDCCB57A424.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

30C07BF3EA2E437DA9CCD2EEF1246BF3.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

80080968E6B54E36AF6332BC95A4EC46.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

E651CE572C16416E8A323F20C37943A1.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

995D59EED7BF44E48EFED5DE0B176A66.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

DEDBF19029324B0AB02C4A252CBBA47F.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

393EE2FC344B46028695C2A38BACF7F6.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BE51C80D068444BA9B230AE486E69BD4.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic.

FF0C3E9549EC49C6950D2CBEC76ACBC8.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

53CC64E0A1BC46CCABEB9A162C80C04D.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear.

B3E96BF12BCA4F29A76A3D21C819603E.description: With prompting and support, identify the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

1C62E8ABF8F74E2FB68CA7AF3DE0E98C.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

2D620C7110D44018B9132913DEB19377.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

764D7D222AAE44CA8CEC0DBB7F415A3F.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

7191CEFBE1BA4C648019A0AD17075FCE.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

02FB17CE5196436EB8E34034E382D155.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

D26E2321854E4D4C800C65B5D4294D84.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

EF6A7BB3B8F9420489C8FF5B4BAF385A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

9BE7D9B95A4D4502AFFDA3407B59EB96.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

38029F01BABE405ABF12B3B8618CEA80.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear.

40FF927CBA9E477399B67B97037C53E6.description: With prompting and support, identify the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

7FB9EAC792864D63B7B8D12770D024D2.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

2F6712EE98C344E386AA62A6D155EB48.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story. Identify beginning/middle/end.

AE3D1F3FBC474B5CA387EF82FD873FF6.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

BF561696FD844F1FBDF7F75560B19ACC.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

155ABC2DC99145A88CA11F9F8C71F229.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

2DC07B8C1CF643119A155BE893F9589B.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

97B984B2AA5F4D0781671C8814AC7F9E.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

E7A0DD3882754FEF952E4CFB3E4D8E8B.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

2BEF0D008E4C4406898BF9EAB95F4BD3.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

38B022131CC9477CA7895D6BB506DAB7.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

893E2DCA69874CB49A73A2AAB54EC6E8.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

E69A1E21CBE84C2DA70BFDFF8212F7E6.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

EF37F2AEB34840A798094672E1623936.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

3821C0234952400788DB7A79720CC2BC.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

BE12EE1DCE564E4C97B3ECD99A8EFE3A.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

B192F3D166A84C13B19A66EDB6353F26.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading

5A5DE6BB2E10418A8C3C2F7115A67A49.description: Read emergent texts with one-to-one correspondence with purpose and understanding.

8D69242511A5407A90486078C81FE8CD.description: Read emergent texts to develop fluency and comprehension skills.

1E961CE0F0F44FD99A5A4E68A3D1371F.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

2BD066F1FC504A5FA56ACB192295A1CF.description: Read common grade-appropriate high-frequency words by sight.

392EE5302B1B4858BC1067D5BEC695D6.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings for the five major vowels.

18DF7740A14A422DA0734568D41D2C52.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound and the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

73E29BE1283E403DA19D516F98CEF4D3.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

E7620D1DDAF94944B09FC24F44DE2538.description: Add, delete, and substitute individual phonemes in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

BEAC256123844BEFA6EE1EB02CC0F83E.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final phonemes in three-phoneme words.

16D7F2982B0C40FAB7DFA16D916FFF10.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

59D62570238E45629CE0438A455246D7.description: Delete syllables in compound words with two syllables.

713A171FB5994D52BE357A0E9FB325AD.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

2B25933F7F9248039FDF6182AFD73D93.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and phonemes.

464B0FAF885944D2A322A4FEB5491970.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

11DE79F7143D47E5935D9758BB7431BE.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

9CD3C1E114C74809A41ED614D6726E48.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

365169B7DEAC4000840EAE950749E052.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

B7245DEB0F09476AB30C2AE205C68F18.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.
